definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: I'm interested in an iron cross second class . an original.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个铁十字感兴趣，二流货，原物。

sentences.english: All loafers must be reformed into good citizens through participation in production.
sentences.chinese: 所有二流子都要受到改造，参加生产，变成好人。

sentences.english: Feel like the absence of a bachelor's degree on your resume is forcing you to settle for a second-rate job?
sentences.chinese: 感到履历里没有学士学位迫使你满足于一份二流工作？

sentences.english: There's just a lot of ignorance and second-rate piping out there.
sentences.chinese: 有太多的麻痹大意和二流管道。

sentences.english: It was really like a second-rate TV drama.
sentences.chinese: 这真像是一部二流电视剧。

sentences.english: I've just got some terrible two-bit job.
sentences.chinese: 我只是找了份二流的工作。
其他的商店都是二流的。

sentences.english: The Chinese are second rate sailors and airmen.
sentences.chinese: 中国的海空军只是二流货色。

sentences.english: Her paintings are second-rate productions, alongside those of some of her contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 她的画作跟她同时代一些人比起来，只算得二流作品。

sentences.english: This arrangement bumps attributes into a second-class role in schema validation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的安排使得属性在模式验证中扮演了二流角色。

sentences.english: Where is the story about second-rate mind games?
sentences.chinese: 关于二流心理游戏的报道在哪里？

sentences.english: Most of the time re-enactments are performed by second-rate actors.
sentences.chinese: 很多时候，它只让一些二流演员来再现场景。

sentences.english: Though performing well enough in the college entrance exam, I was only provided with the opportunity to enroll in a second-class university.
sentences.chinese: 尽管在高考表现不错，我也只是考取了一所二流大学。

definition: peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
switch to a job one was not trained for
(lit.) name not encountered in the classics/unknown (person)/nobody
to degenerate/impoverished/to fall (into poverty)/to be reduced (to begging)
to be considered as outstanding or special/to be reckoned with/notable
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
